channel.title: Comments for Odd Ball Podcast – WJCT Public Media

item.title: Comment on Noor Nisa, 18 (right), was in labor and en route to the hospital with her mother and husband, in Badakhshan Province, Afghanistan, when his car broke down. Lynsey Addario ended up driving Nisa to the hospital, where she delivered a baby girl. November 2009 by WJCT
item.dc:creator: WJCT
item.description:
Jill,
Try contacting Addario directly through her website:
http://www.lynseyaddario.com/info/print-sales/
item.content:encoded:
Jill,

Try contacting Addario directly through her website:

http://www.lynseyaddario.com/info/print-sales/

item.title: Comment on Don Skidmore likes his work maintaining a golf course, but it isn’t where he imagined himself at age 60. by Mike
item.dc:creator: Mike
item.description: Do any of us end up where we imagined we would be when we were young? Take Care Don- (aka "elvis" Ropsumbuub)
item.content:encoded: Do any of us end up where we imagined we would be when we were young? Take Care Don- (aka “elvis” Ropsumbuub)

item.title: Comment on Composer Frank Loesser with his wife and musical partner, Lynn Garland, in 1956 in New York. Decades later, Loesser’s “Baby, It’s Cold Outside” is being banned by radio stations. by Cheryl Reed
item.dc:creator: Cheryl Reed
item.description: It’s stupid to judge this song by today’s standards- it was a different time-
item.content:encoded: It’s stupid to judge this song by today’s standards- it was a different time-

item.title: Comment on Noor Nisa, 18 (right), was in labor and en route to the hospital with her mother and husband, in Badakhshan Province, Afghanistan, when his car broke down. Lynsey Addario ended up driving Nisa to the hospital, where she delivered a baby girl. November 2009 by Jill Kersey
item.dc:creator: Jill Kersey
item.description: Hi I love this image by Lynsey Addario and cannot access a poster of it. I want this photo on my lounge wall to remind me of the plight of Afghanistan women..please help me access it!
item.content:encoded: Hi I love this image by Lynsey Addario and cannot access a poster of it. I want this photo on my lounge wall to remind me of the plight of Afghanistan women..please help me access it!
